name: Supporting a Youth in Crisis
description: You find yourself sitting at your desk needing to find a way out. The History Teacher is talking about the paper that is due in a week, you look down and see you haven't even started writing your paper. You think back to the fact that you still have one Biology lab, one Math quiz and one Chemistry exam in the same week. The room begins to feel like it's slanting, your palms are sweating, you feel your heart beating faster and your hands begin to shake - how will you escape and find help?

conclusion_data.header_text: Great job, you escaped the Youth in Crisis Escape Room! Thank you for playing! You were able to find support for the character and got some insight on what it can be like if you are in a crisis. To learn more about ConnecTeen please visit our website here.
conclusion_data.paragraph_text: By solving the puzzles and going through the room, you have learnt important skills such as being aware of triggers (many tasks, lots of school work), techniques you can use when having an anxiety attack, and helpful resources. When you are in a crisis, it is hard to see options and ask for help. You may feel like you don't deserve help, may talk down to yourself, and experience low self-esteem when going through a challenging time. During these times, you can use the coping strategies you learnt about today such as music, reading, music and journaling to help feel better. You should also remember that it is okay to reach out for help and support - your friends as well as Calgary ConnecTeen are available for your support.

data.text: You're a high school student in class. Your teacher Mr. Smith says, "Alright, now we are going to be talking about the 8 page history paper due next week, there will be 4 components to the structure..."

You look down at your agenda. "8 page paper, in a week!? I still have a Bio lab, Math quiz and a Chem exam I have to prepare for next week. I can't, I just can't. It's impossible. I can't breath. What am I going to do??"

Your hands start to tremble as you grasp your chest, you can't even tell if you are breathing properly anymore. You feel like you are going to pass out. Everything begins to look blurry and you notice your body start to subtly shake.
"I have to get out of here, I have to go home. I feel like I'm gonna puke." Escape the room to get back home!
You waved to Skylar. They look at you briefly then look back down at their desk.
The teacher enters the room and everyone goes to their seats. Class is going to start soon.
Mr. Smith greeted everyone good morning then asked the class to open up the text book to start class.
Skylar is the only one without a textbook. I wonder why. That doesn't matter though I can offer to share mine for today.
"Hey Skylar, I noticed you don't have a text book. We can share mine!"
Skylar looked surprised at first then they smiled. They look relieved and their leg has stopped shaking from earlier.
Mr. Smith finished their lecture and it's time for our break. Skylar thanked you for sharing your textbook. They haven't bought theirs yet as its pretty expensive.

Everyone walked on over to the group sitting area. You get up to go eat lunch with everyone and notice that Skylar is the only person who hasn't walked over. Maybe if we strike up a conversation we can invite them over casually.
Skylar smiles and starts to talk about their favorite character. You too laugh for a bit and then you invite them over to eat lunch. They agree and you both head on over to the group.

You had fun at lunch with everyone. Now it's time for the group project. Everyone looks really nervous again. You're in a group of 4 and happen to be paired with Alex, Gray and Skylar. Everyone begins to discuss.
